subject: JUnitPerf with Parameterized Test Case Design Pattern
msgSnippet: I have a question about using JUnitPerf to decorate tests that used the Parameterized Test Case Design Pattern (JUnit Recipes, 4.8). The PTCDP had me create a
messageBody:
I have a question about using JUnitPerf to decorate tests that used
the Parameterized Test Case Design Pattern (JUnit Recipes, 4.8).

The PTCDP had me create a constructor that accepted a number of
arguments (3 in my case). All good for functional testing. But now I
am trying to decorate this test with JUnitPerf....and 1) it is awkward
to say the least to call my test, 2) all the functionality I had for
iterating test cases from the file system no longer works.

It's that JUnitPerf wants me to call the constructor...and now the
constructor has a bunch of arguments. I guess I need to add my
functionality to iterate test cases from the file system...which is
hardcoded into my JUNit class....just copy that functionality and do
it here too. Not a big problem....but I thought I might be
overlooking some simple or OO solution. Am I?

Mike
blog: http://spaces.msn.com/michael01612

Test testCase = new GetQuotesJUnitTest
